ulysses_supercomputer.title: Ulysses Supercomputer: Modernism's Social Combinatorics
ulysses_supercomputer.desc: "Ulysses Supercomputer" draws on recent studies of the early twentieth century as a prefiguration of the contemporary digital age to develop a novel interpretation of Joyce's Ulysses and early cubist collage. I argue that both artists' use of the newspaper as a device indicates a commitment to an aleatory aesthetic that nonetheless remains grounded in social context. I conclude by suggesting that this conception of "social combinatorics" might be valuable for for interpreting the output of today's large language models.

drama_life_dedalus.title: Drama, Life, and Stephen Dedalus: The Fate of Aestheticism in Joyce
drama_life_dedalus.desc: "Drama, Life, and Stephen Dedalus" traces Joyce's presentation of his literary surrogate from Stephen Hero to Ulysses, with particular attention to his tendency to see the world in aesthetic terms. Although the early Joyce takes this proclivity to be admirable, I show that it becomes a farce in A Portrait and a tragedy in Ulysses.
